outputs.output_descr: The Social Action Plan that was submitted to Paris III included the need to implement projects that will have immediate positive impact on improving the lives of those most poor and vulnerable. Within this framework, the government is keen to put into action around 14 safety net programmes, one of which is targeting the disabled through the "Right and Access Programme". Increasing allocations of Right and Access is indispensable to cater for the chronic needs of the disabled and to cover the emerging requests of the newly disabled as a result of the war. The project contains two outputs, to improve the provision of good quality reliable and suitable aids to the persons registered as disabled, and to cater for the new disabled groups that emerged as a result of the July 2006 war.
